intro: Malvastrum scabrum var. tucumanense, commonly known as the Tucumán thornapple, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Argentina and Bolivia. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its spiny stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or disturbed soils. The species is also noted for its medicinal properties, with some traditional uses in local herbal remedies.
